definition: to stare blankly/to be stunned/to be lost in thought
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: Black Email is spacing out in the corner, contemplating an alternative life in Nara City.
sentences.chinese: 黑郵件在角落裏發呆，想着奈良城的別有洞天。

sentences.english: But more mouthed along listlessly or stared in silence.
sentences.chinese: 但更多的人只是無精打采地張着嘴或默默地發呆。

sentences.english: She was dumbly dismayed at the news.
sentences.chinese: 聽見那消息她驚愕得發呆了。

sentences.english: He was left alone and agape .
sentences.chinese: 剩下他獨自一個張大著嘴發呆。

sentences.english: He looked vaguely up the marble staircase.
sentences.chinese: 他發呆地望了一望大理石鋪成的樓梯。

sentences.english: Or we do nothing alone, where a daze.
sentences.chinese: 要麼就什麼也不做在那裏獨自發呆。

sentences.english: Why to always syare blankly ineffably , feel sadness namely next.
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼總是莫名的發呆，然後就是感到悲傷。

sentences.english: The boy mooned about all day until his dog was found.
sentences.chinese: 在找到他的狗之前，那個男孩整天都在發呆。

sentences.english: Work fascinates me - I can look at it for hours!
sentences.chinese: 工作使我着迷，我可以單單對着它發呆幾個小時。

sentences.english: But you were spaced -out the whole day yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 但是你昨天一整天都在發呆啊。

sentences.english: I found her on the seashore,dreaming away as usual.
sentences.chinese: 我在海濱找到了她，像往常一樣她又在那兒發呆。

sentences.english: I always stared the other side of the road in a daze.
sentences.chinese: 我總是怔怔地往着路的那邊發呆。

sentences.english: I just clunked myself down in cafe and wiled away afternoons.
sentences.chinese: 我就是在咖啡館裏發呆，消磨時間。

sentences.english: She was benumbed with grief at the death of her husband.
sentences.chinese: 她因痛失丈夫而傷心得發呆。

sentences.english: Still occasionally a daze looking at your photos, lists, one with a giggle.
sentences.chinese: 偶爾還是會看着你的照片發呆，發傻，一個人傻笑着。

definition: to be in the sun (getting warm or sunbathing etc)/to put sth in the sun (e.g. to dry it)
what are you doing?/what's he up to?
to talk to oneself/to think aloud/to soliloquize
a moment/a while/in a moment/also pr. [yi1 hui3]
